question: Which of the following would not make a distinction between a hire purchase and a ‘normal’ purchase?
option1: Purchaser pays for item by instalments over a period of time
option2: Asset does not belong to purchaser when delivery is received from supplier
option3: Cost to buyer is likely to be higher than it would be for a normal purchase
option4: Trade discounts cannot be offered on hire purchase
answer: Trade discounts cannot be offered on hire purchase
explanation: Purchaser pays for items, Assets and cost to buyer will make a distinction between a hire purchase and a ‘normal’ purchase.
